properties.name: www.HolyRadio.org
properties.description: Posted by CatholicwifiradiElkhart, INHoly Radio (WHLY 1580 AM) is an independent, listener supported, non-profit radio station dedicated to spreading the light of Jesus Christ to the world by bringing you the best in Catholic radio programming in accordance with the Magisterium of the Catholic Church. Dedicated to Mary Most Holy, Holy Radio serves the South Bend, Indiana metropolitan area which is part of the Diocese of Fort Wayne – South Bend. WHLY covers a population area of approximately 330,000 people in the South Bend and Michiana area, including the University of Notre Dame, St. Mary\'s College and Holy Cross College.

properties.name: www.RedeemerRadio.com
properties.description: Posted by Catholicwifiradi4705 Illinois Road, Fort Wayne, INRedeemer Radio is a response to Pope John Paul II’s urging to Catholics to become involved in what he termed “The New Evangelization” of the world by means of the mass media. He encouraged all Catholics to utilize modern media to help spread the Catholic Faith. Redeemer Radio was formed in 2002 by lay Catholics answering the call of Pope John Paul II to use modern media to spread the Catholic faith. We began purchasing airtime on a commercial radio station to broadcast "Catholic Answers Live" weekdays in drive-time. Listener response was overwhelming with the show becoming the station\'s number one rated program. In December 2005 Redeemer Radio purchased WLYV 1450AM - bringing full-time Catholic radio to our area. The mission of Redeemer Radio is to employ radio broadcasting to evangelize, to bring inactive Catholics back to the Church and make good Catholics better - so that all may know, understand, live and be able to share the fullness of the faith. Our focus is greater Fort Wayne and the entire diocese of Fort Wayne-South Bend with obedience to our bishop, Most Reverend John M. D’Arcy, and fidelity to the Church’s teachings. Our programming is from the heart of the Church – positive, unifying and with broad appeal, in collaboration with the diocese. Chris Langford, Redeemer Radio president and co-founder, notes that “we are very excited about bringing Catholic radio to Northeast Indiana. The truth and beauty of the Catholic faith will be available to all who tune in. Lives will change.” Mr. Langford goes on to say that “the very fabric of our culture is under attack by modern forces working against the good of society. This attack is often carried out through the media. It is vitally important that Catholic radio be a force in the media to defend and explain the truth about today’s critical issues.” Fort Wayne Catholic Radio, Inc. (“Redeemer Radio”) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization founded in 2002 and located in Ft. Wayne, IN. Founded and led by lay Catholics, Redeemer Radio’s charter is to own and operate Catholic radio stations within the Catholic diocese of Fort Wayne-South Bend.
